com.davidsoergel.trees

Interface TaxonMergingPhylogeny<T extends Serializable>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RootedPhylogeny<T>, SerializableRootedPhylogeny<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRootedPhylogeny, BasicRootedPhylogeny

    public interface TaxonMergingPhylogeny<T extends Serializable>
    A phylogenetic tree supporting the extraction of subtrees and ignoring branches with no length
    Version:
    $Id: TaxonMergingPhylogeny.java 341 2009-09-04 21:28:09Z soergel $
    Author:
    David Soergel

      T nearestAncestorWithBranchLength(T id)
      Locate the node with the given id, and navigate up the tree if necessary, until a node is found that has a branch length greater than zero.

    • Method Detail

      • nearestAncestorWithBranchLength

        T nearestAncestorWithBranchLength(T id)
                                                       throws NoSuchNodeException
        Locate the node with the given id, and navigate up the tree if necessary, until a node is found that has a branch length greater than zero.
        Parameters:
        id - the T identifying the starting node
        Returns:
        the T identifying the most recent ancestor of the given node with a nonzero branch length (perhaps the node itself)
        Throws:
        NoSuchNodeException - when the target node is not found in the tree, or when no node with a branch length is found

      • extractTreeWithLeafIDs

        BasicRootedPhylogeny<T> extractTreeWithLeafIDs(Set<T> ids,
                                             boolean ignoreAbsentNodes,
                                             boolean includeInternalBranches,
                                             AbstractRootedPhylogeny.MutualExclusionResolutionMode mode)
                                                                    throws NoSuchNodeException
        Extract a tree which contains exactly those leaves that are requested. I.e., prunes any branches not leading to those leaves. Aggregates chains of nodes with exactly one child each into a single branch of the appropriate length, if requested. Creates the extracted tree from newly instantiated nodes; does not reuse nodes from the base tree. Some of the requested leaves my turn out to be internal nodes; that's OK.
        Parameters:
        ids - the Collection of leaves desired for the extracted tree
        ignoreAbsentNodes - silently ignore requests for leaves that are not present in the tree, simply returning the extracted tree with those leaves that are found. I.e., intersect the requested leaf id list with the available leaf ids before constructing the result tree.
        mode -
        Returns:
        the extracted RootedPhylogeny
        Throws:
        NoSuchNodeException - when the given collection contains a node id that is not found in the tree and ignoreAbsentNodes is false

      • extractTreeWithLeafIDs

        BasicRootedPhylogeny<T> extractTreeWithLeafIDs(Set<T> ids,
                                             boolean ignoreAbsentNodes,
                                             boolean includeInternalBranches)
                                                                    throws NoSuchNodeException
        Throws:
        NoSuchNodeException

List<T> getAncestorPathIds(T id)
                                                throws NoSuchNodeException

      • getAncestorPathAsBasic

        @NotNull
List<BasicPhylogenyNode<T>> getAncestorPathAsBasic(T id)
                                                                        throws NoSuchNodeException
        Returns a List of nodes leading from the root to the leaf identified by the given ID. Guarantees that the nodes are represented as BasicPhylogenyNodes, copying them if necessary, because we want them to be Serializable. As a result, the child lists may not be populated.
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        NoSuchNodeException
